text:
Message 1851 of 4024
I hope you can take a moment and approve this again. If we are intellectually honest with each other, we are doing things to get things done already;
I'm just in danger.
1-1 FYI, emails with inline comments seem like a no-brainer. We have AD basketball camp, SAAS state tournament, and Mark's AMEX that all fit
that bill recently.
Plain 1-1 emails with you where we drop a 3rd party seem incredibly useful but are not allowed either. We really needed that yesterday to act on SAAS
quickly.
Emergency OFW calls are a no-brainer. SAAS was urgent enough for you to reach out to me immediately. I need the same option if you are just not
available.
I hope you see none of these are a threat to your safety. I do not abuse them. They allow for common sense communications to be more effective co-
parents.
Let's please not turn this into a counterproductive scoreboard exercise. If you allow us the means to communicate in a timely and effective way, it will
work wonders.
Thanks for your consideration...
-robert
Sent:03/05/2024 at 07:13 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 03/05/2024 at 07:22 AM)
Subject:Re: Attached Inline and Urgent
Message 1852 of 4024
That is fine, but your instructions to me to do you a favor really come across as an order like I work a minimum wage job for you. We have a very odd
and unequal dynamic at the moment. Will do.
Sent:03/05/2024 at 07:16 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 03/05/2024 at 07:22 AM)
Subject:Re: Xfinity
Message 1853 of 4024
Sorry I did not mean for it to come across. I was trying to respond in between tasks. Noted.
Sent:03/05/2024 at 07:23 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 03/05/2024 at 07:23 AM)
Subject:Re: Xfinity
Message 1854 of 4024

Sent:03/05/2024 at 09:31 AM
From:Robert Moyer

Subject:Dr Brown Today
